Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: We paid £65 for a room here including breakfast - for London that's amazing. But if you're paying £65 you cant expect too much. I was pleasantly surprised by the room, although it was really small, it was recently re-furbished and was really quite nice. The photos on the website haven't been updated yet and really don't do it justice. The bathroom was really tiny though - I'm not a big person but i found it a squeeze in the shower. Free Wifi Parking is great you can literally park right outside and it's free 1830-0830 which was perfect for us. Russell Square is a 5 min walk away. Breakfast was pretty good too. All in all I'd say this hotel is really good value for money - as long as you're not expecting too much. I'd stay again on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Small but smashing”
Reviews.Author: nicecoldbeers
Reviews.Content: £60 a night, next door to a pub, 5 min walk from King's Cross, clean and friendly. What more do you want for a budget London hotel - I've stayed in far, far worse for this price range. 5 stars if they heat the beans more! :D

Reviews.Title: “Mabledon Court ..small but sweet”
Reviews.Author: Frillylil
Reviews.Content: |I thought this was a lovely little hotel for a quick London visit.It was clean and comfortable, if a trifle small. The chap at reception was delightfully helpful and so were all the staff I encountered. It is perfectly situated for King's Cross and Euston, and convenient for popping along to Bloomsbury. They also provided a most acceptable cooked breakfast, and for the price, I would recommend it heartily.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for one night”
Reviews.Author: alldon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was close to Euston, because I got a reasonable rate and it's not a chain. The room was miniscule (more a single with a double bed in it ) but for what I wanted it was adequate. There is a lovely old-fashioned, quirky lift. The bed was comfortable and clean but very little space in the room. The shower was also bijou but hot and strong, even if it turned into a wet room. The room was very warm but the windows opened and I always carry war plugs, so that wasn't a problem. The rate included breakfast which although not huge was freshly cooked. There is also a lounge beside the breakfast room. Reception is 24 hours and very friendly. There is a pub selling food right next door, the usual chain restaurants on Euston Road and more individual restaurants a short walk away in Bloomsbury.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: You have to understand with property prices in central London always high and rental prices to match the owners must get as much money as is possible from the square footage of the hotel. Knowing this economic necessity we were not surprised the rooms were small. They were however very clean and comfortable with all that was necessary. They are en-suite. They looked as if they had recently been refurbished. There was a flat screen tv and tea and coffee facilities. We certainly were not intending to stay in but get out and make the most of our short holiday, The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was quiet. Breakfast was full Engish plus a buffet of cereal and fruit. So you could eat all you wanted. The standard of the food was surprisingly excellent with each Full English cooked seperately. But the real bonus is that this Hotel is within easy walking distance of Three main line stations and several underground stations. You will find travel expensive in central London so that is a huge saving and also enables you to see more. There is a good cinema within walking distance at the Brunswick centre. The neighbourhood must be one of the pleasantist in London. We were there on Christmas day and enjoyed an amazing lunch at a nearby Greek restaurant. Thank you Mabledon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angie R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst overnighting to get the train from Euston to Wales. Great location from Euston station about 500m and not far to Kings Cross Station. The rooms are small but clean. Comfortable bed. Breakfast was included but we didn't have it as we left before it started at 7.30am. The bathroom is tiny, you can just fit in the shower cubicle, its like one you would have in a motorhome. Reception very helpful. Free Wifi. We went walking up the road near Kings Cross for dinner. Location is excellent. The pub next door is nice. All in all, I would say it was a bargin for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lauriecumb
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location, near rail stations, and bus routes to central London. Rooms are very small, but our bed was comfortable, there was very little noise at night, the breakfast in a bright basement room was fine, and there is even a decent pub next door. The rates are reasonable by London standards. Friendly and helpful staff too. We would happily return here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but rooms are very small”
Reviews.Author: a979
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located, just a few minutes away from Camden, but the rooms (and the bathroom) are very small. Also, expect it to be a bit noisy..

Reviews.Title: “happily surprised,good location, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Viqtorea
Reviews.Content: From reading the previous reviews I was quite worried about this hotel. Things to note: it is a budget hotel. Yes the rooms are small and a little tired but thats london. The staff at the mabledon were very friendly and helpful. The room we had was small but was clean. We stayed for 2 days. Breakfast was very good, continental breakfast was self-service/buffet, and cooked breakfast was made to order. They were fast and friendly and we had a good amount of food and didn't need to eat lunch. Free wifi was good and we used it a lot. A lot of people have complained this hotel is bad but its a budget hotel, maybe your expectations are too high.

Reviews.Title: “the worst room i have ever seen in 50 years of hotel use worldwide”
Reviews.Author: golfmalaga
Reviews.Content: we arrived for a 1 night stay, the room was small and terrible,the bed looked dirty, guatanamo bay must be better.we did not intend sleeping in that room on the ground floor,so we checked out within 20 minutes of arriving,and had to pay another EIGHTY FIVE pounds for the dump,even though we had not slept the night.sleeping outside in a park would have been a better bet,disgusting place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but too expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: slocker1
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic and the staff were very helpful and even kept our luggage after we checked out until we were ready to get the train home. The room was badly decorated and stuffy but thanks to the fan that was easy to sort out. The breakfast was nice. The cost was too high for what you get , but with it being London it is kind of expected. They need to get prices down to reflect what they give.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: stephjenks
Reviews.Content: It was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Cost Â£135 per night for a a room like a broom cupboard with the temperature of a sauna. When I asked to swap rooms I was told they are all the same. I could not fit a chair between the bed and the dressing table so had to sit on the bed to dry my hair. The bed was hard and I could feel the springs in the mattress. For breakfast I asked for bacon on toast and was presented with one slice of toast and one slice of bacon

Reviews.Title: “dreadful, tiny, overpriced, filthy”
Reviews.Author: museum-a-day
Reviews.Content: The room was so small, it was impossible for the 2 of us to stand up and move around the bed at the same time. Paint was peeling off several surfaces; the chair and curtain were ripped and looked like they had been salvaged from garbage on the curb. Bathroom was ancient, rusty, no toiletries provided; bathroom door didnâ€™t close. I know moderate priced hotel rooms in central London are small and sparse, but, at 145 ounds, this is vastly overpriced and squalid. The breakfast was Ok. Surprisingly, the free internet in the room was actually a strong signal.. We chose it because it is very near Euston Station, but there are many other chain hotels in the area that are probably a lot better for the same price. Definitely the worst, most disappointing, over-priced dump we've stayed in, in over 30 years of travelling..

Reviews.Title: “I will never set foot in this place again”
Reviews.Author: WestYorksBigHead
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a very hot day after a long train journey. The room was on the top floor and tiny. The furniture was shabby and old and the bathroom was awful. The shower was tiny and there was no cold water. I assume the tank must be on the roof and the heat of the day had 'boiled' it. The room was so hot I didn't get a wink of sleep. I had to open the window so also had the noise of a very busy road to contend with too. All for Â£135!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: greasergal
Reviews.Content: Even though I had read some bad reviews my husband and I decided to try it anyway. What a mistake!!! The room was tiny, the bathroom was disgusting, the shower was (no exaggeration) 2 feet by 2 feet, and there was no air conditioning. And to top it off, you have to give them your key if you leave and get it back when you return (like it's some fancy hotel in the 1920's! PUH-LEEZ!). But the icing on the cake is that we told them on the first night we wanted to cancel the rest of our stay. My reservation with Expedia said we had to give 48 hours notice. So we stayed there 2 nights and then when we go to check out, they tell us we didn't cancel through Expedia and then they charged me 65 pounds. REALLY?? They purposely didn't tell me that 2 days before when I cancelled with them. They told me "no problem." Thieves. Stay somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY THERE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beverleydylan
Reviews.Content: I was meant to stay there for 4 nights but we checked out after 1! The rooms are horrible especially the shower! If you decide to take a shower the bathroom will be literately flooded and will smell of damp. There is no fan either!!!!!!!! I wouldn't even pay more than Â£40 for a night & I paid a Â£100! Its also really noisy!! One of the worst hotels EVER!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Uncoordinated and unmanaged”
Reviews.Author: travellingtrainer123
Reviews.Content: Stuffy room, don't expect to retrieve anything of value as there is noone to take any responsibility - no managers, no acknowledgement of e-mails - more like a backpackers

Reviews.Title: “Not sure!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole_Allison
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it is only a five minute walk to St Pancras international Train Station as we were leaving for Paris the next day. This is the highlight of the hotel. As it is a budget hotel, costing 65 pounds for the night which is good for London, i was not expecting much. The room and bathroom was small, bed was uncomfortable and was squeezed up against 2 walls which meant that one person had to climb over another to get in and out of the bed. The room is so small that i would be really uncomfortable for a stay more than a night. Overall this was not a big deal, as this was a very quick stopover, however the next day i woke up with rashes all over my legs which lasted for a week. If you are worried about catching something, do not book this hotel. However on the plus, its really close to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but unbelievably shabby and small, with hole in carpet and windowsill dropping in bits.”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireRosie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quiet and comfortable, it is handy for St Pancras and Kings Cross stations and there is a good breakfast. There is a great pub next door which does good value meals. When you have said that the rest is negative. The Large Deluxe Double Room measured 9' x 9', with a 4'6" bed pushed into the corner. Standard double rooms have a 4' bed. The bathroom was unbelieveable. There was a grate in the middle of the floor with filth all round it, the shower was too small for my size 10 to fit in without having the shower curtain sticking to me. There was a hole in the carpet (see photo) and the windowsill had to be seen to be believed (see photo). The room resembled a squat. One night was certainly enough.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bmalzoubi
Reviews.Content: very kind and friendly staff specially Ahmad Hasan and andy

Reviews.Title: “Do not even think about staying !!”
Reviews.Author: FarmerJohn45
Reviews.Content: My wife and i had stayed in 3 star hotels all around England, Wales and Scotland on our holidays - we had booked 2 nights via the internet in this supposed 3 star hotel in Bloomsbury as it was close to things we wanted to see. On arrival we were charged on our credit card, for the 2 nights and allocated a room on the first floor. First we could not fit our regulation airline luggage and ourselves in the lift so I sent my wife via that and walked up to find a room that was the smallest double room I have ever seen. It looked tired and on a closer inspection, it smelt and had marked and dirty paintwork. The bed was jammed against two walls so the person on the inside would have to clamber over the other to get out (not good for the older traveller who needs the loo in the night). We told the Desk clerk that this room was unsatisfactory and he offerred us another on the third floor. Whilst slightly larger, it also smelt and had cracked and stained paint and wallpaper, the windowsill was exploding with dry rot and the catches were broken off the windows. The bathroom was indescrobable, a ten year old would have trouble fitting in the shower stall. Again we told the clerk that it was unsatisfactory but he could offer no solution so we told him we were leaving immediately - he would only offer a refund of the second nights charge, when I protested he told me it was hotel policy to charge one night cancellation fee!!! we did not cancel we marched out in high dudgeon-- I have subsequently demanded a refund to no avail - one email from them even said we stayed and used the facilities which shows how out of touch they are. I have now challenged the charge via my credit card and expect to solve the matter that way - however I would recommend that anyone looking to stay in London find another hotel, this one is definitely not 3 star, in fact not even half a star. There are many other good hotels in this area, gio to one of them

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Giannidimarco
Reviews.Content: Complete rip off go elsewhere Floorboards squeak, showers are too small, toilets don't work, springs pop out of the bed and into the back. I asked for my money back for the second night as it was so bad and the staff refused the request And refused to give me the manager's number to speak with him. A complete rip off which ruined my fiancÃ©e's opinion of London. Such a shame that my capital city has cowboys like these.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: annlambert1
Reviews.Content: We booked a large de-luxe room. Not with the wildest imagination did our room meet the description. It was dirty, smelly, desparately in need of decorating. We found the staff quite intimadating. You have been warned, stay far away. I would sooner sleep on a park bench than face a night there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff and good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: ANNEANDBOB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. 5 mins walk to Russel Square tube. There is a lovely pub next door to the hotel " Mabels". who do reasonably priced meals. The hotel rooms are on the small side so be warned anyone on the large size as the shower was very small. I am only 5 foot and only just fit in !! The breakfast was lovely although a little variation would have ben nice! ( Owners -- Try adding mushrooms, fried bread, hash browns now and again ? ) Very nice and friendly staff. Would recommend and will be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, pity about the room”
Reviews.Author: JillFrance
Reviews.Content: Plus points : great position if using Euston, Kings Cross or St Pancras. Friendly, helpful staff and a good full breakfast in a delightful dining-room. Minus points : Creeky floorboards throughout.Total lack of sound-proofing. Awful drain smell in shower-room. Shower-room door did not fit so could not be closed. Very poor wifi connection.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, dishonest management”
Reviews.Author: Bloomsburybusiness
Reviews.Content: Via internet I booked a room for 5 nights. The eservation was quickly confirmed by the hotel. A few days later I found that I had to delay my London visit by a few weeks and cancelled my reservation. This time the hotel did not confirm. I therefore asked a friend in London to telephone the hotel. She was told, in un unfriendly way, that no cancellation had been received and that the cost for the first night would be charged. In spite of the cancellation being sent more than 48 hours before. My Visa account was indeed charged and with an amount higher than that agreed for a single room. Previous reviews about this hotel have told a similar story. My conclusion: Do not trust the hotel management's statement that there will be no charge for a room cancelled with 48 hours notice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Soomka
Reviews.Content: Pros - - A BRILLIANT location, five minutes walk from Kings Cross. Very convenient. - Staff were all extremely friendly and eager to help. Cons - - The pillows. I'm not normally one to complain about this sort of thing but the two on the bed were flat, heavy, just plain uncomfortable: you might as well not have had one at all. We then found one (!) decent pillow in the cupboard (why it was in there I have no idea). - The (presumably underfloor, we did check that the radiator was off) heating was turned up way too high, another thing that made it hard to get a good night's sleep. The rooms are very small, but it's ideal if you're just looking for somewhere to crash that's close to Kings Cross. I wouldn't want to stay there for more than a couple of nights though.

Reviews.Title: “Served a purpose”
Reviews.Author: paulaNorfolk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days whilst having a look around London. This hotel served the purpose it was close to Kings cross station, it provided a a good breakfast including yogurt, fruit, toast, cereal and full english fry up with tea coffee and juice. The rooms are small and tired but ours was clean the bedding was fresh and clean the towels clean and soft and changed each day. I do think for the Â£150 paid over Easter weekend it was probably the best I could have found. However wouldnt have wanted to stay longer than the 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: joacosarroca
Reviews.Content: Before booking the hotel I checked some comments, that make me think twice before booking but finnaly I decided to book it. It is true that the rooms are small, also de bathroom, but since you are in london paying a very low price for well located place you cannot complaint. And moreover if you are in london for holidays where you only use the room to sleep. Also you have an excellent english breakfast that is not found in other cheap hostels, think that with it you are saving many pounds! The staff is very nice and all was clean. For that price the place is very recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Unlikely to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Medhurst
Reviews.Content: OK there are some bad reviews on here and I can completely understand why but I'll start with the good points. 1. It's close to Euston station (5-10 mins walk) 2. We found it pretty clean, not spotless but definitely clean. 3. The breaksfast is quite nice but not enough of it if you're used to a buffet style breakfast. 4. the reception guys are friendly, polite and helpful. 5. For London its not too expensive but having said that, given the bad points it's not really value for money. Now for the bad points 1. The rooms are VERY small (we booked a double room to find that the bed was actually a 3/4 and we could hardly move about unless one of us sat on the bed for the other to pass 2. The showers are useless and the shower heads look like they need replacing 3. Rooms are roasting hot, even in December with the radiator turned off?! 4. The walls are paper thin (really!) 5. Some of the breakfast staff are rude, unhelpful and inefficient 6. Last serving of breakfast is 9am, the breakfast room is small, there are only 2 tables to seat more than 2 people and you have to queue unless you're there early, the milk is left out from I presume 7.30am so it's not cold. 7. The handle of our window came off in my hand when I went to open it - this was truly the 'Fawlty Towers' moment and I think had we not laughed, we'd have cried! All in all, not a terrible stay and if you're not expecting much then you won't be dissappointed but I can't say I'd recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare - never again”
Reviews.Author: PrimroseWales
Reviews.Content: what an awful experience. we booked for two nights and checked out after the first. (we have been to many hotels and never have we even thought about checking out).If we could have found somewhere else that night we would not have stayed the one night in that awful hotel. it was extremely small and smelly, the bathroom was disguisting. My son had a shower and the drain could not cope with the water, it flooded the bathroom. I could not even bring myself to have a shower. i moved a bin to find a tampon, this indicated that the room had not even been cleaned. the cleanliness of the hotel was below average. it advertised on line a garden view, what a joke, the garden view was a yard which had been neglected with half a dozen mattresses stored there collecting alsorts of bacteria. We could not even bring ourselves to have breakfast. Also the health and safety aspect was poor as the kettle was resting on a shelf with the cable dangling. This hotel should certainly not have 3 *

Reviews.Title: “URGH! Don't Go There!!”
Reviews.Author: saddler14
Reviews.Content: It was well situated - but that is its only redeeming quality. What little full english breakfast there was, was good - but not enough of it. (One slice of bacon, one sausage, half a small tomato, one fried egg and a small spoon of beans). The Rooms We had two rooms which were equally as bad as each other. The wallpaper was very 'tired' and discoloured with damp patches surrounding the window and on the ceiling. Bathroom was tiny and discouraged us from using the shower as the shower head was disgraceful. The staff were friendly, but surely there are better places to spend Â£300 on two rooms for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms and small cooked breakfast consisting of 1 sausage, 1 rasher bacon, 1 egg and half cherry tomatoe”
Reviews.Author: SallyWirral
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as had travelled with family to visit son for his 21st Birthday. Couldn't for the life of me see any distinction between the double/single rooms! They all looked the same - small! The tubs of milk in the room had gone off, and although the restaurant was very pleasant in comparison to the rooms, the cooked breakfast was rather insulting regarding the size! In conclusion, taking everything into account - size really does matter!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid-Charged for no-show when I never gor their confirmation”
Reviews.Author: HamsterBruxelles
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I got charged for nothing!! I sent an online availability request for six nights and gave my credit card number. I never heard back from the hotel, despite the fact that I gave them two email addresses. I wrote an email to them the following day as a reminder and I know they read it because I have the read receipt. Again no answer. I was in a hurry to get a hotel reservation therefore I booked elsewhere. They dared to charge me for one night when they never dared to reply. I sent another email asking to refund me, needless to say I got zero answer. I called them up and the most rude and unpleasant man answered me saying that they have an automatic software that sends email. I THINK THEY THEY ARE JUST ROUTINELY ROB TOURISTS ON ONLINE RESERVATIONS. TOO LATE I SAW ANOTHER COMPLAINT LIKE MINE ONLY AFTERWARDS!!

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our break, DONT GO HERE!”
Reviews.Author: churchillWales
Reviews.Content: First impressions, we were around the corner from Madame Tussards, so the location was great. However, when we first went into the hotel the man behind the counter was very disinterested we were booking in. We were asked to pay for the room straightaway. I asked the man if he could print us out a google map for directions to Soho, he said no but i could buy a map for Â£3. Went into room 27, it was like walking into a wardrobe, the room could hardly fit a bed in! The bed took up the space literaly from wall to wall. Went into the 'bathroom', the shower was tiny. Im a size 6 and i could just about fit in it! it was just a corner with a shower net. On the floor of the bathroom was another drain, after i had my shower i understood why. Even with the poor net it was impossible not to get the floor wet! The floor was full of mildew! As you can see with my photos. When i seen the mildew, i decided to check the bed. To my horror there was urine staines on the bed and mildew! This really spoilt my birthday weekend, i slept with a towel underneath me and no blankets! The view i had was one of a 'courtyard' with a lovely view of old beds with holes and springs hanging out. I have visited many hotels, and hostels around the world and i can honestly say this is the worst place i have ever stayed in. I have even stayed in the generater in london and that was much more cleaner! For the money i spent i was very disappointed! There are better hostels for next to nothing in price! I wish i had checked the reviews before going!

Reviews.Title: “great location and really not bad”
Reviews.Author: antenne2
Reviews.Content: Ok, this hotel is not perfect. The rooms are quite small, the shower is tiny, the floorboards creak, it gets very stuffy at night and the rooms at the front are quite noisy. But for one night on the way to France it was fine. The guy on the desk was helpful, there is a lift (it's quite old but it works...), the room was clean and had everything I needed (plus nice biscuits) and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast in the pleasant breakfast room was very good and the service was friendly and efficient. There are plenty of places to eat nearby in the evening and it's so conveniently situated, between Euston and St Pancras. It's fine for the price and I'd stay there again, but I wouldn't really recomment it for a longer stay

Reviews.Title: “Location is about it.”
Reviews.Author: Woguy
Reviews.Content: The best things about the Mabledon Court are its location (close to King's Cross-St. Pancras, a major rail and underground station), and its price, which is fairly reasonable for London. The rooms, generally, are small and hot, with the bathrooms especially oppressive. If you front the street, you will find it noisy. The staff is generally congenial and breakfast is good, but that is not enough to draw us back for a second stay.

Reviews.Title: “Budget choice”
Reviews.Author: Davep140
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel for a short stay on a budget. Plusses include the friendly staff, nice breakfast room and good breakfast. The hotel is very close to mainline and underground stations. On the minus side the rooms are small, the beds are small and the shower is very small. We stayed during the June heatwave and the bathroom was unbearably hot. We managed to cool the room a little by placing the fan on the window ledge. We had a room at the back which was surprisingly quiet apart from the squeaky floorboards. Shame about the old mattresses on the patio.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: Grassy23
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay here for 1 night unfortunately had to cancel. I cancelled the booking 3 weeks beforehand...yet my card was charged the full amout despite reassurances that it would not be. E-mails were/are ignored and phone calls haven't yielded any sucess I have spoken to various members of staff including the manager and despite promises of a refund none has been forthcoming.

Reviews.Title: “The position was good.”
Reviews.Author: venusbathstravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was only a few minutes walk from St Pancras and Kings Cross stations. It's next to a pub and there are a selection of eateries nearby. Laundrette, small supermarket and a great bookshop are just up the street, so the location was excellent for us as we arrived from Heathrow (via train) and were departing the next morning for Paris on the Eurostar at St Pancras Station (home of the terribly over-rated champagne bar). As for the hotel, well. The double bed was pushed up against the wall, it was a struggle to open our small suitcase - the only way was to put it on the bed. The bathroom was ancient, well everything was very old. But there was a fan which we needed as the afternoon sun blazed in, and we did sleep well. I think it was all clean enough, it's just hard to make things look good when they're so old. The breakfast room was delightful and I think if we'd discovered it earlier we could have used the area to relax in the evening. Not suitable for anyone with a disability as the elevator only worked if everyone shut both doors. Otherwise you had to run through the floors to locate it, or use the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful - the worst hotel we have ever had the misfortune to stay in”
Reviews.Author: not_happy2Midlands
Reviews.Content: The room was filthy, paint peeling from the window an window ledge, "net" curtain torn shower area covered in mould, quite frankly words cannot discribe how bad it was.The rating for the sorry experience would be zero.The only recommendation I could offer is DO NOT GO THERE.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews; it is that bad!”
Reviews.Author: bohobird
Reviews.Content: As written before double rooms are tiny; bed was pushed up against the wall, which was pushed up against a peeling melamine type board. There were countless strands of long hair embedded in the carpet. The wallpaper was peeling in more than one place, and was stained with, what looked like tea/coffee. The paint on the window sill was peeling all over. No storage space at all. Shower room was more of a shower cupboard, floor was mouldy. Didn`t like the look of the bed, with its ripped base. Breakfast, okish. Staff weren`t that bothered when we complained. We fled after one night.(would have not stayed the first night if we weren`t going to be charged for it eitherway)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Mouldy with Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: JoolsM08
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed in. Good points - the breakfast and eastern european staff who serve breakfast. I stayed there for four nights whilst waiting to move into a flat - but got bitten several times in one night. I bought a cotton sheet to wrap myself in after that and flip flops to use in the joke shower The bathroom was dirty, mouldy and smelled strongly of decay. Carpets were never hoovered properly, the shelf for a desk was stained with other people's food and the covers, curtains, wallpaper were long past their best. I spent three evenings walking around London just to stay out of this dirty, horrible room.

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford to pay a bit more do not go there!”
Reviews.Author: LadyVonDutch
Reviews.Content: Put it this way... the breakfast is bad....the floor in the room squeeks and the rooms are really tiny. If you want to take a shower you cannot move as the cubicle is about 40cm by 40cm. The service in general is rather bad. I asked for some towels as the cleaner forgot to put them in the room and when I rang reception I was told: "When you come downstairs I will give them to you".....basically come and get them yourself!... The staff is friendly but crap at doing their job. Also be careful cos when you arrive they will ask you to pay for the whole stay in advance...( I think it is because they are scared that once you see the rooms you want to leave!). It's because I did not have the money and the time otherwise I would have changed hotel. The only positive thing is that it is very central ( near Euston - Kings cross and camdentown ) so you dont even have to get a bus or tube to go to the heart of London... i think it is good for backpakkers who do not care about noise and are not bothered too much about little inconveniences like mentioned above. Just avoid it if you can but is not that bad... i actually had a lot of fun although I had to get drunk in order to sleep as we were in room 27 near the lift and the emergency exit door and that was the only room on that floor where the floorboard where cracking and making funny noises so we could hear every night and every morning people passing by to get the lift.

Reviews.Title: “War on Terror”
Reviews.Author: Stay007
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so rubbish due to the fact that nothing was in a clean state, staff don't speak english, the guy at reception looked like he was a ghost, they use loft insulation sheets for bedding, bed bugs. I can go on for ages but please for your safety dont go there I am suffering from my stay I have got an infection from the bed bugs. How did the health and safety pass it?

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Friendly staff excellent price”
Reviews.Author: pildyboys
Reviews.Content: The room was on the small side, however, everything worked, tea and coffee was provided in the room, alonf with tv, hairdryer, showering lotions etc. Free Wi Fi was available. The breakfast was very good, all hot and fresh with as much continental style as you could eat, followed by a cooked english breakfast as well. All the staff were very freindly, and informative. At the price I paid, I could not ask for more. After all you general need a good comfortable bed, in a clean room, not a ballroom sized room, when you are out all day. I will return

Reviews.Title: “Chicks_8”
Reviews.Author: Chick_8
Reviews.Content: Not a nice start to our holiday. Behind reception desk very messy. Our double room was tiny, you could hardly get in with two suitcases and the bed was against the wall. Dirty windows with a broken catch, dated fabrics, tiny shower with badly split rubberised discoloured curtain. Noisy pub next door. The breakfast was nice but we were leaving too early for a cooked one. Expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “What a doss house”
Reviews.Author: Pops10
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I would not recommend anyone to stay, it is the pits. How this can be classified as a hotel beggers believe, well maybe for the homeless. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “great location, manky shower”
Reviews.Author: DrJenCat
Reviews.Content: For a hotel opposite the British Library where you have an ensuite room, this hotel is very good value. The rooms are very hot (and get hotter the higher up the building you go), but the windows open and fans are provided. We had no problems with the tv and the staff were just lovely. The front desk is staffed 24 hours a day. The breakfast is fine. But the showers are quite manky - and very small. Still, if you want this location on a budget you'd be hard pressed to match this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGirl08
Reviews.Content: I had an awful experience at the Mabledon Court Hotel in London. There were many reasons that it was so bad, but I will tell you exactly why. Firstly, the staff was quite rude. I had some problems with the room and they dealt with it rather badly. I for one found blood on the sheets (they claimed that it was coffee), and I had requested a separate bed and they did not provide that for me and instead gave me a one double bed stating that there are no separate beds there. I think that personally they should have told me this when booking instead of realizing it upon my arrival. Also because it's a very old hotel, I could hear everything going on around me. The walls were very thin, and I could hear everyone walking around above my room. Also, at the end of my stay, I requested that I get an invoice for my stay but they had problems with this stating that I should have requested it at the beginning. I had a few problems but my colleagues also had problems that I will leave unmentioned. I think that's all but the bottom line is I advise you NOT to stay here. Even though it is a superb location, I think that you can find a much better place to stay - especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not worth 3* rating”
Reviews.Author: puma377
Reviews.Content: Having previously read the reviews on this hotel I wasnt expecting too much and I wasnt disappointed. It was a very basic hotel. Not sure it warrants the 3* it claims to be. The room was small, the bathroom was reasonable but the shower cubical was tiny, and smelt musty. The sheets were clean, the tv had no aereal so i could only get channel 5. I couldnt work out whether the nets were black or black through dirt. The staff were friendly and helpful. Fortunately I ionly booked the one night and spent most of the evening dining out. On my return the lights on the stairs werent working and only seemed to be on every other floor. The lights in my room didnt work in the morning but a staff member fixed it promptly, I dont know if they turn the lights off at night to save money. The breakfast was ok. I If you want close proximity to Kings X, the British Library etc its ok. I dont think I'll stay there again, but it wasnt bad for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: bridgetjanejones
Reviews.Content: The double room we stayed in was not a bad size. Clean and loads of coffee/tea/milk facilities. The ensuite bathroom didn't have any air filter or window so it smelled musty. Small shower. Because of the bathroom I wouldn't want to stay there for any more than a day or so. The breakfast was good and at Â£75 a night for a double room and breakfast it was good value for money. Especially considering the excellent location and closeness to Euston/King's Cross and St Pancras. Friendly staff. Would definitely use again for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient rather than luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: phil_daflava
Reviews.Content: I did a quick google search for Hotels in the London Area near Euston Station and this was one of the cheapest ones I found. I was slightly worried after booking it as I read some of the negative reviews, but when I got there I found the hotel to be absolutely fine. + Plus points: Freindly receptionist, clean room with tea/coffee facilities, full english breakfast included, back-street (quiet) location, walking distance from dozens of places to eat, walking distance from Euston, Kings Cross, and St Pancras. - Negative points: Budget hotel. Don't expect the Ritz, but if you just need somewhere to sleep and have breakfast, you can't go wrong here. All in all, recommended.. if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “OK as a place to crash the night before catching Eurostar”
Reviews.Author: powerpup
Reviews.Content: As everyone else has said, the room is small. But having said that, it was spotlessly clean, the breakfast was good, and the staff were helpful. Free WiFi is available for your PDA or Laptop (they will give you a password at reception). Beware that the rate quoted on Expedia does not include VAT @ 17.5% We paid Â£70 + VAT for a double room = Â£82.25 Also when booking through Expedia, your Credit Card guarentees booking, but no money has been taken at the booking stage. (Don't be surprised when you are asked for payment at the reception desk !) I wouldn't want to stay here for any length of time, as the small room would have eventually done my head in. My wife and I used this as a place to crash the night before a trip on Eurostar, and in this respect the room was fit for purpose. You can easily spend Â£200 for a room in this part of London, so this is pretty good value. Euston, St Pancras, and Kings Cross Stations are in easy walking distance (you won't need a cab unless you really are unable to walk). There is a pub next door which serves food, and there are many eateries within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “No room for you sir”
Reviews.Author: FredFreeloader
Reviews.Content: Booked room for two nights through hotel website, then asked through email to extend by one nite, which they approved. Sure enough, on arrival there was no room, no person with my name on their booking list and no hope. I went to a cybercaf to print out my booking docs and suddenly they found the room (and my name) in their system. The first night however had disappeared and I had to go elsewhere for it (48hrs cancellation policy meant that I had to go back for nights two and three). Bizarre. The room itself on 4th floor was quiet (to the back) and in reasonable nick. I paid 75 for a single. I shall not go back.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: strelizia
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel likely after having escaped from the Alahanbra hotel (terrible) and i think we were really lucky. The people there are estremely kind and they gav e us the room at the top floor with garden view. It was very peacefull, no noise , we slept perfectly. the breakfast was huge, a very big buffet! we stayed there 8 nights. the location is perfect ..near to king cross's tube station and the area is safe in the night also.

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious hotel”
Reviews.Author: raubian_globetrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a recent conference trip to London. Only chose the place because of the location which was situated close to Kings Cross station. Rooms are extremey small and musty and it can get quite warm in the summer. You're better off staying at one of the Premier travel inns for the price you pay for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Considered this as the worst hotel I have stayed in- for those desperate only!”
Reviews.Author: geebowie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner in September and let him make the choice of hotels, entrusting that he would have good taste. After he had booked and I myself looked at the reviews of this hotel, i had an instant feeling that we had made a mistake and we were not proven wrong To this day we are now extra cautious as we do not want to make this kind of mistake again! The hotel is on a side street and is extremely small from the outside, so is the reception, there is no particular lobby and we were put in a what I would describe as a box room on the first floor, had hardly any room to walk around, the head of the bed was against one wall and the foot of our bed was touching the window curtains and joined to the window sill, so you can imagine how small the room is, My partner and I had to give way to each other if either of us needed to step from the desk and chair area to the bathroom which is also extremely small with the shower, sink and toilet so close to each other, The door to the bathroom is thin can hear everything! The shower has a plastic curtain but the water is not contained in and leaks out onto the floor of the bathroom and down a drain, cannot walk around the bathroom without getting feet wet. Toletries provided were of cheap quality. The service is average, the one person front desk staff did not seem particularly bothered and was quite offish, told us that there were no other bigger rooms for that night but could offer to switch the next day if there were, When i requested for fresh towels in the morning I was told I can get them myself downstairs. The most positive note was the breakfast which was included in the price but was average, quite a nice cosy setting but the menu is limited in choice and service seemed very slow. What was intended to be a 3 night stay was cut short to one night only and we had to find another hotel, which there are an abundance of in London and for much better price and quality so personally I would only suggest that you stay here ONLY if desperate or feel is absolute necessary being close to Kings Cross station, Euston or anything else there nearby.

Reviews.Title: “More B&B!”
Reviews.Author: Brutu
Reviews.Content: I concur with the previous review, this hotel, or more realistically - B&B - is ideal for small persons/couples wishing to stay in London. Overall I and my wife had an excellent experiance the four nights we stayed there, costs were excelent for the twin ensuit room - approx GBP45 per night - this was a special Xmas price from an internet site. Staff were very helpful and even lent me a laptop to access the internet from my rm on the second floor. Mac owners beware, the wireless network is incompatable. On the whole, I'd highly recommend this hotel if singles were priced below GBP50 and doubles below GBP60. Breakfast is a bonus, although bacon and eggs a bit on the small side. Location is ideal, two rail stations and three tube stations all within easy walking distance. Close to the British Museum, British Library and major universities. Also good access for shopping, sightseeing and the theatre. I will utilise this hotel again if the price is right. One major bug, the rooms are indeed small and bathroom unit is a must see if you get my meaning. As such, if a small person make the best of it, if a giant, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “OK for small people.”
Reviews.Author: J-CDup
Reviews.Content: Definitely the smallest hotel rooms I have ever seen. The whole room is about the size of an average bathroom. But, the location is great, the price is reasonable (by London standards) and the staff are friendly.

HotelInfo.Name: Mabledon Court Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 10-11 Mabledon Place | Bloomsbury, Camden, London WC1H 9BA, England
